ai.summary: Green Walk is a 7.8 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom suitable for walkers with some experience, offering a mix of scenery and varied terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-defined paths, grassy tracks, and occasional rocky or muddy sections. The route has moderate elevation change and can be uneven in places.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the weather before you go and be prepared for sudden changes in the UK. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers. Carry a map and compass (or fully charged GPS) and do not rely solely on smartphones. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. Bring enough water and a snack, plus a small first aid kit. If the trail is exposed or winds are high, consider sun protection and warm layers. In winter, be mindful of ice and shorter daylight; plan for shorter daylight hours and have a headtorch. If the path runs near roads or water, stay on marked paths and watch for mud and slippery rock.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (breathable top, insulating layer, waterproof shell)
Water bottle (at least 1–2 liters) and snacks
Map and compass, or fully charged GPS device
Small first aid kit and whistle
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish or dim conditions)
Phone with emergency numbers and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn are generally best for clear trails and milder conditions. Winter hikes are possible but can be cold, muddy, and daylight hours are shorter; plan accordingly.
